text: If you want something you’ve never had, you must be willing to do something you’ve never done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The body achieves what the mind believes.
author: Erin Gray

text: Once you are exercising regularly, the hardest thing is to stop it.
author: Erin Gray

text: If you don’t make time for exercise, you’ll probably have to make time for illness.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Rome wasn’t built in a day, but they worked on it every single day.
author: Michael John Bobak

text: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
author: Michael John Bobak

text: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: I don’t count my sit-ups. I only start counting when it starts hurting because they’re the only ones that count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Go the extra mile. It’s never crowded.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Take care of your body. It’s the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Sean Patrick Flanery

text: Your health account, your bank account, they’re the same thing. The more you put in, the more you can take out.
author: Jack LaLanne

text: Don’t say ‘I can’t.’ Say, ‘I presently struggle with’.
author: Tony Horton

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryun

text: Your body can stand almost anything. It's your mind that you have to convince.
author: Andrew Murphy

text: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.
author: George Halas

text: Ability is what you’re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
author: Lou Holtz

text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
author: Muhammad Ali

text: To keep the body in good health is a duty… otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
author: Buddha

text: When it comes to eating right and exercising, there is no ‘I’ll start tomorrow’.
author: VL Allineare

text: We do not stop exercising because we grow old- we grow old because we stop exercising.
author: Dr. Kenneth Cooper

text: The mind is the most important part of achieving any fitness goal. Mental change always comes before physical change.
author: Matt McGorry

text: It always seems impossible until it is done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: You don’t have to be good at it, you just have to do it.
author: Karine Candice Kong

text: In training, you listen to your body. In competition, you tell your body to shut up.
author: Rich Froning Jr.

text: You’re going to have to let it hurt. Let it suck. The harder you work, the better you will look. Your appearance isn’t parallel to how heavy you lift, it’s parallel to how hard you work.
author: Joe Mangianello

text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Jerry Dunn

text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside of you that is greater than any obstacle.
author: Christian D. Larson

text: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
author: Vince Lombardi Jr

text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
author: Karen Lamb

text: Don’t give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.
author: John Wooden

text: Most people fail, not because of lack of desire, but, because of lack of commitment.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Exercise is labor without weariness.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: The first time I see a jogger smiling, I'll consider it.
author: Joan Rivers

text: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
author: Michal Joan Bobak

text: Look in the mirror. That’s your competition.
author: John Assaraf

text: Put all excuses aside and remember this: You are capable.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.
author: Hippocrates

text: If you think lifting is dangerous, try being weak. Being weak is dangerous.
author: Bret Contreras

text: There is a moment when you get older when your metabolism slows down and you don't feel like working out anymore, so you don't want to keep yourself fit anymore, but that's your decision. Why should you be judged for it?
author: Janet Jackson

text: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: Our bodies are our gardens – our wills are our gardeners.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The clock is ticking. Are you becoming the person you want to be?
author: Greg Plitt

text: Exercise is king. Nutrition is queen. Put them together and you’ve got a kingdom.
author: Jack LaLanne

text: Success is what comes after your stop making excuses.
author: Luis Galarza

text: Here's what I tell anybody and this is what I believe. The greatest gift we have is the gift of life. We understand that. That comes from our Creator. We're given a body. Now you may not like it, but you can maximize that body the best it can be maximized.
author: Mike Ditka

text: The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: I'm not a waif-y girl and never will be. I think it's healthy when fitness experts encourage fitness rather than getting a certain body shape.
author: Sophia Bush

text: Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.
author: Marquis de Sade

text: The only way for a rich man to be healthy is by exercise and abstinence, to live as if he were poor.
author: William Temple

text: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

text: A champion is someone who gets up when they can’t.
author: Jack Dempsey

text: Number one, like yourself. Number two, you have to eat healthy. And number three, you've got to squeeze your buns. That's my formula.
author: Richard Simmons

text: Today I will do what others won’t, so tomorrow I can accomplish what others can’t.
author: Jerry Rice

text: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The muscle and the mind must become one. One without the other is zero.
author: Lee Haney

text: Living a healthy lifestyle will only deprive you of poor health, lethargy, and fat.
author: Jill Johnson

text: If you don’t find the time, if you don’t do the work, you don’t get the results.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Exercise should be regarded as tribute to the heart.
author: Gene Tunney

text: Just believe in yourself. Even if you don’t, just pretend that you do and at some point, you will.
author: Venus Williams

text: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Ideas are the beginning points of all fortunes.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
author: Benjamin Spock

text: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

text: Talk doesn't cook rice.
author: Chinese proverb

text: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
author: Larry Elder

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The undertaking of a new action brings new strength.
author: Richard Evans

text: All know the way; few actually walk it.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Life is movement-we breathe, we eat, we walk, we move!
author: John Pierrakos

text: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
author: Bernadette Devlin

text: You have to believe in yourself.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: So long as a person is capable of self-renewal they are a living being.
author: Henri-Frederic Amiel

text: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: Annie Dillard

text: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
author: Bruce Lee

text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

text: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Those who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try nothing and succeed.
author: Lloyd Jones

text: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
author: Ralph Emerson

text: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
author: Bernice Reagon

text: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
author: Seneca

text: You always succeed in producing a result.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Who we are never changes. Who we think we are does.
author: Mary Almanac

text: Your body is precious. It is our vehicle for awakening. Treat it with care.
author: Buddha

text: What separates the winners from the losers is how a person reacts to each new twist of fate.
author: Donald Trump

text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: A champion is someone who gets up when they can’t.
author: Jack Dempsey

text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Sleep is that golden chain that ties health and our bodies together.
author: Thomas Dekker

text: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: You would be surprised what two hours of daily exercise and five hundred stomach crunches can do for you.
author: Justina Chen Headley

text: I don’t stop when I’m tired. I only stop when I’m done.
author: Marshawn Lynch

text: I’m not telling you it’s going to be easy, I’m telling you it’s going to be worth it.
author: Art Williams
